verbs.description: gutturize (third-person singular simple present gutturizes, present participle gutturizing, simple past and past participle gutturized)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make (a sound) in the throat; to gutturalize.
examples: How particularly fine the hard theta is in an English termination, as in that grand word — Death — for which the Germans gutturize a sound that puts you in mind of nothing but a loathsome toad.
